uncertainty in the beginning stages. However, the current dominant analytical perspectives are grounded

. Some literature is beginning to focus on mitigation through
and lifestyle changes, but specific policy measures for supporting such changes and their
contribution to emission reductions remain unclear (see also Section 4.4.2 and Chapter 5).
Recent research shows that temperature increases are likely to exceed 1.5°C during the 2030s and 2°C
. Because of their short lifetimes (days to a decade and a half), SLCFs can
provide fast mitigation, potentially avoiding warming of up to 0
.6 ºC at 2050 and up to 1.2 ºC at 2100
